net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher

Class AbstractCharacterFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher.AbstractCharacterFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CharacterFetcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBufferedCharacterFetcher

    public abstract class AbstractCharacterFetcher
extends Object
implements CharacterFetcher
    AbstractCharacterFetcher is a sensible base implementation of CharacterFetcher.

    Implementers must only implement a single simplified method that copies all characters from an Readable to an Appendable: doCopy(Readable, Appendable, FetchProgressListener).

    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

                   throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: CharacterFetcher
        Fetches the content of a given Readable into a fresh char[].

        See CharacterFetcher.copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Specified by:
        fetch in interface CharacterFetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        Returns:
        A new char[], containing the content of the given Readable.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable.

        Throws:

      • copy

        public final void copy(Readable in,
                       Appendable out,
                       boolean closeIn,
                       boolean closeOut)
                throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: CharacterFetcher
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        Missing or invalid arguments are handled gracefully with the following behaviour.

        A null is given as an Readable, it is simply ignored and handled as if there was nothing to read. If closeOut is true, the given Appendable will be closed anyway

        A null is given as an Appendable, it is simply ignored, but the content of given Readable is fetched anyway. If closeIn is true, the given Readable will be closed anyway

        Specified by:
        copy in interface CharacterFetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        closeIn - Whether to close the given Readable, after reading from it, if the given Readable is Closeable.
        closeOut - Whether to close the given Appendable, after appending to it, if the given Appendable is Closeable.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or appending to the given Appendable. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close one of the given streams, if requested, are ignored.

      • copy

        public final void copy(Readable in,
                       Appendable out,
                       FetchProgressListener listener)
                throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: CharacterFetcher
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        See CharacterFetcher.copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Specified by:
        copy in interface CharacterFetcher
        Parameters:

        out - The Appendable to write to.
        listener - The FetchProgressListener to report to.
        Throws:

      • copy

        public final void copy(Readable in,
                       Appendable out,
                       FetchProgressListener listener,
                       boolean closeIn,
                       boolean closeOut)
                throws FetchException
        Description copied from interface: CharacterFetcher
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        Missing or invalid arguments are handled gracefully with the following behaviour.

        A null is given as an Readable, it is simply ignored and handled as if there was nothing to read. If closeOut is true, the given Appendable will be closed anyway

        A null is given as an Appendable, it is simply ignored, but the content of given Readable is fetched anyway. If closeIn is true, the given Readable will be closed anyway

        Specified by:
        copy in interface CharacterFetcher
        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        listener - The FetchProgressListener to report to.
        closeIn - Whether to close the given Readable, after reading from it, if the given Readable is Closeable.
        closeOut - Whether to close the given Appendable, after appending to it, if the given Appendable is Closeable.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or appending to the given Appendable. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close one of the given streams, if requested, are ignored.

      • doCopy

        protected abstract void doCopy(Readable in,
                               Appendable out,
                               FetchProgressListener listener)
                        throws FetchException
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        It is guaranteed that neither the given Readable nor the given Appendable nor the given FetchProgressListener is null.

        Implementers must not close either of the given streams.

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        listener - The FetchProgressListener to report to.
        Throws:
        FetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or writing to the given Appendable.
